techmeme.title: WBD lost $300M on gaming in 2024; current and former staffers blame a lack of a strong, cohesive vision during former games chief David Haddad's tenure (Jason Schreier/Bloomberg)
Microsoft warns that attackers are injecting malware into ViewState, which manages state in ASP.NET web forms, using static machine keys found online (Sergiu Gatlan/BleepingComputer)
Google has edited Gemini's response in a Super Bowl commercial after it was found to contain false information about Gouda cheese (Emma Roth/The Verge)
HIG Capital plans to buy Toronto-based IT solution provider Converge Technology for $908M and merge it with Mainline Information; the deal closes in Q2, 2025 (Charles Capel/Bloomberg)
Meta and UNESCO launch Language Technology Partner Program to collect speech recordings and transcriptions to aid the development of future openly available AI (Kyle Wiggers/TechCrunch)
